front.title: IEEE Recommended Practice for Specifying Electric Submersible Pump CablePolypropylene Insulation

author.organization: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

front.abstract: Minimum requirements for the design, construction, manufacturing, testing, purchasing, and application of electric submersible pump cable are presented. The cable is round or flat, with polypropylene rubber insulation, nitrile or polyethylene jacket, and armor. These cables are for voltages not exceeding 3 kV or 5 kV (phase to phase) and conductor temperatures not exceeding 96 C (205 F) maximum for nitrile or a maximum minimum of 10 C (14 F) minimum. Conductors, insulation, assembly and with or without jacket, armor, requirements for testing by the manufacturer, and cable ampacity are all covered in the document.
